sailpoint.task

Class AbstractTaskExecutor

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.task.AbstractTaskExecutor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BaseExecutor, TaskExecutor
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasePluginTaskExecutor

    public abstract class AbstractTaskExecutor
extends java.lang.Object
implements TaskExecutor
    An implementation of TaskExecutor that provides a set of common utilities for executor classes.

    • Field Detail

      • ARG_LOCK_MODE

        public static final java.lang.String ARG_LOCK_MODE
        Optional argument to specify how Identity objects are locked during iteration. This is used in two contexts, while iterating over the Identity table in a refresh task, and while correlating accounts during an aggregation task.

        Normally this will not be set and, by default, a transaction lock is acquired. It can be set to "none" in case you need to disable locking in an emergency (like it does not work). It can also be set to "persistent" which will acquire persistent locks instead of transaction locks, though this has much more overhead.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ARG_LOCK_TIMEOUT

        public static final java.lang.String ARG_LOCK_TIMEOUT
        Argument specifying the maximum number of seconds to wait to acquire a lock when lockMode is "persistent". This is actually a retry count with an implicit one second delay between retries so a timeout of 1 means two attempts with a one second pause before the second attempt.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_LOCK_TIMEOUT

        public static final int DEFAULT_LOCK_TIMEOUT
        Default lock timeout. When refreshing identities with lots of links (one customer has over 3800 links on some identities) this can take quite awhile to refresh. 30 seconds was too low, not sure where the sweet spot is.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ARG_FILTER

        public static final java.lang.String ARG_FILTER
        Optional filter string to restrict the identities that get refreshed.
        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • processCommand

        public void processCommand(Request cmd)
        Ask the executor to perform a command encapsulated in a Request. This was added to support capturing task stack traces while they are running, but it is general and may have other uses.
        Specified by:
        processCommand in interface BaseExecutor

      • updateProgress

        public void updateProgress(SailPointContext ctx,
                           TaskResult result,
                           java.lang.String progressString)
                    throws GeneralException
        Update the current execution progress. This method requires that the TaskDefinition's ProgressMode is either Percent or String. This method will use the task definitions defined progressInterval to figure out how often the task result will be modified and written to the database.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

                           java.lang.String progressString,

                    throws GeneralException
        Update progress and also report the percentage complete from 0 to 100.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • launchPartitions

        public void launchPartitions(SailPointContext context,
                             TaskResult result,
                             java.util.List<Request> requests)
                      throws GeneralException
        Schedule a set of requests that will all share the same task result. This is intended to be called from TaskExecutors that want to convert themselves to a partitioned task using Request objects. This is a new 6.2 feature used to achieve multi-machine parallelism.

        This method does not do anything that that the TaskExecutor could not do but it is a set of steps that always need to be done so it was factored it into a RequestManager utility method for sharing.

        The important thing is that once a Request object has been committed to the database the TaskResult must be marked as "partitioned". If for some reason any request cannot be launched, do not mark the task result so the TaskManager can mark it completed.

        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • saveRequest

        public void saveRequest(SailPointContext context,
                        TaskResult result,
                        Request request)
                 throws GeneralException
        Save a Request and associate it with given task result. This is intended to be used for saving requests as they are created during aggregator partitioning. This is an extension to 6.2 multi-machine parallelism feature.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • getSuggestedPartitionCount

        protected int getSuggestedPartitionCount(SailPointContext context,
                                         boolean includeInactive,
                                         java.lang.String requestDefinitionName)
                                  throws GeneralException
        Calculates the suggested partition count based on the registered Server objects and their request threads count. This is just a wrapper for calling this function without the need for populating active servers
        Parameters:
        context - The context.
        includeInactive - True if inactive servers should be included in the count.
        Returns:
        The sum of the request threads of the configured servers.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • getSuggestedPartitionCount

        protected int getSuggestedPartitionCount(SailPointContext context,
                                         boolean includeInactive,
                                         java.lang.String requestDefinitionName,
                                         java.util.List<Server> o_servers)
                                  throws GeneralException
        Calculates the suggested partition count based on the registered Server objects and their request threads count.
        Parameters:
        context - The context.
        includeInactive - True if inactive servers should be included in the count.
        o_servers - list where servers are to be populated
        Returns:
        The sum of the request threads of the configured servers.
        Throws:
        GeneralException
